intro: Noccaea birolmutlui, commonly known as the Birol's honesty plant, is a flowering plant species belonging to the Brassicaceae family. It is characterized by its small, cruciform flowers and pinnately divided leaves. The plant typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils and is found in alpine or subalpine regions. It has a compact growth habit and produces achenes as its fruit type. Noccaea birolmutlui is of interest to botanists due to its limited distribution and potential adaptations to high-altitude environments.
